intro: Xylophacos argentinus, commonly known as the Argentine woodrose, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine. Its leaves are simple and opposite, while its flowers are clustered in racemose inflorescences. Xylophacos argentinus is also valued for its ornamental appeal due to its vibrant blooms and unique growth form.
